channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How Gazans are arriving on mystery flights in South Africa, paying Rs 1.77 lakh per seat
Madvi Hidma killed: How top Maoist commander, who evaded security forces for years, was killed in 4 hours
Menstrual masking: Are you ready to add period blood to your skincare routine?
Is Trump’s grip on Republicans and the Maga movement starting to slip?
Is IT firm Cognizant tracking the time employees are spending on laptops?
Why the US selling F-35 fighter jets to Saudi Arabia is controversial
G20 Johannesburg summit: How to sail the age of polycrisis?
item.description: Working in isolation, neither the Global North nor the Global South can resolve the world’s problems

item.title: Belém climate summit must shift from promises to purposeful action
item.description: The overarching theme of Cop30 is ‘Delivering on the Paris Promise’, emphasising the acceleration of climate commitment implementation and the shift from promises to tangible, purposive action

item.title: What Delhi can learn from Beijing in fighting air pollution
item.description: Beijing provides a model for New Delhi. Through strict multi-faceted measures, including urban rail expansion, satellite monitoring, electric vehicles, and low emission zones, the Chinese capital reduced air pollution by up to 89 per cent in a decade despite tripling vehicle numbers

item.title: ‘Slaughter’ of Christians or crude oil? Why Trump is talking about Nigeria
item.description: Donald Trump has threatened military action in Nigeria based on wrong data as Africa’s biggest oil refinery in Lagos disrupts traditional supply chains

item.title: How ‘white-collar terrorism’ is not a new phenomenon
item.description: White-collar terrorism has long existed, particularly in Kashmir, but its evolving; highly educated networks now require a comprehensive and modern strategy to counter them

item.title: Belem climate summit: Bridging North-South divide will be uphill task for Brazil
item.description: Brazil is leaving no stone unturned to make Cop30 remarkable, but it must unite the Global North and South to forge new cooperation against their common enemy—climate change
